intro: Malache lasiopetala, commonly known as the rough-leaved malache, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rough, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in shady, moist environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
